review.title: Convenient Hotel
review.reviewText: The Hotel was passable, clean rooms and a not bad location.

review.title: Nice hotel in the middle of town.
review.reviewText: With a touch of traditional mexican sleeping, San Francisco is a great place to stay at.

review.title: Gave A Second Chance, Result, More Disappointment
review.reviewText: First time check in was horrible front desk was very rude. Room was not comfortable but the highlight was there was a great waiter at the restaurant who took great care of us and the food was good. So we try them again couple months later, this time restaurant staff and food are both bad and it cost more. I will never stay here again. A new girl was being trained at front desk, vet could not find my reservation so I gave her all the details she replies: "Oh it is expedia, you are expedia people, let me tell you about her." She proceeds to rudely talk about me as if I am expedia and lets everyone else in line who is not "expedia people" go first because she needs time to finish talking. When she is done I notice bags are gone they tell me someone will take them to my room. I did not have pesos yet so bellboy got angry. Going to dinner I could hear him at front desk talking about me. At restaurant there was a nice waiter who exchanged money for us and food was good. He was the only nice person, others kept passing us, glaring, and talking about the bellboy's no tip because he did not want USD story. We tip bellboy in pesos on way back to room and he and front desk laugh at us to our faces. In room bed is not firm and bathroom so small you wet it entirely including towels when showering drain is not even in shower so this is known problem. We check out decide due to restaurant we will try again, it was not all bad. Well bellboy replaced the waiter, service and food was bad
review.positiveRemarks: On first stay I liked the restaurant my second stay proved they were not improving but devolving and I will not go back
review.negativeRemarks: Friendliness and courtesy of front desk staff who are quite rude. Better staff quality management as the bellboy from my first visit was promoted
review.locationRemarks: The location is run down did not feel safe to walk around from window of restaurant did not find anything worth doing outside except grab taxi to go

review.title: NICE HOTEL GRAT FOOD
review.reviewText: NICE HOTEL GRAT FOOD A BIG PARKING HAD POOL VERY CLEAN ROOMS

review.title: chimar0215
review.reviewText: Good location, good pricing for the area and our business needs,

review.title: Saturday night in Tapachula!
review.reviewText: The hotel was fine, room large and clean, bed comfortable, then around eleven o'clock we went to bed, but the Night Club opposite didn't. The noise rattled our ribs. At midnight my husband got up and asked reception to move us, which they did, the room was not as nice (smaller) and we could still hear the noise but we were so exhausted we slept.None of this was the fault of the hotel, but I would avoid it at the weekend.
review.negativeRemarks: Close down the Night Club opposite!
review.locationRemarks: Not much nearby, only stayed here one night en route to Mexico City.

review.title: Good choice
review.reviewText: Very clean and spacious. Small pool area. Staff seem genuinely pleased to see you. Great breakfast buffet. Very good value.

Clean and well kept hotel, friendly staff but there is a chicken restaurant nearby and the room smelled like fried chicken all the time. 

I would give it a 4 if it wasn't for the smell... and I love chicken but not as a scent in my room.
review.positiveRemarks: friendly staff, easy access, good price, clean
review.negativeRemarks: Try a way to keep external odors away

review.title: Inexpensive and good. But not it's not the USA.
review.reviewText: This Hotel is not for Americans that want to stay in America.  But if you are travelling to Mexico, and want to experience the Country. This place is clean, everything works. but it's really Mexico.
review.locationRemarks: Its not in a pleasant location. You get what you get.
